page.title: 03CATWORTH, Cambridgeshire
page.content:
This village of just over 100 houses, three thatched, some 17/18th but most 19/20th Century, two farms, two inns, enjoys a rural atmosphere while having good road access to London, Cambridge, Peterborough, Northampton and Bedford.
In addition to Garage/Motor repairs, only one shop remains, incorporating the Post Office, plus a "Dairy" from which milk bottled at Fenstanton is delivered to surrounding villages. Until 1984 there was also a Creamery + Grocers which opened on Sunday, thus offering a service to local villages. This milk now delivered from Ringstead Northamptonshire. Mobile vans - meat, fish, shoes, vegetables - visit weekly also the Huntingdon Mobile Library.
SEE ALSO Clubs, POW HOSTEL, EDUCATION, EMPLOYMENT and RELIGION
